description: First prime starting a chain of exactly n consecutive primes congruent to 5 modulo 6.
comments: The term "exactly" means that before the first and after the last primes of chain, the immediate primes are not congruent to 5 modulo 6.a(21)>2^31, a(22)= 766319189. - _Hugo Pfoertner_, Jul 31 2003
links: Giovanni Resta, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..35 (terms < 4*10^14)
prog: See link in A085516.(PARI) okchain(n, p) = {if ((precprime(p-1) % 6) == 5, return (0)); for (i=1, n, if ((p % 6) != 5, return (0)); p = nextprime(p+1);); if ((p % 6) == 5, 0, 1);}a(n) = {p = 5; while (! okchain(n, p), p = nextprime(p+1)); p;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Dec 17 2013
author: _Labos Elemer_, Jun 05 2000
extensions: More terms from Reiner Martin (reinermartin(AT)hotmail.com), Jul 18 2001
